findings.title: Rule parsing and evaluation bugs
findings.description: Ensure that rule parsing and evaluation bugs are carefully ruled out.

findings.title: Timing attacks on rule evaluation
findings.description: Consider potential situations in which timing attacks on rule evaluation due to non-constant-time rules and short-circuiting could leak configuration details or secret strings via a statistical attack.

findings.title: Denial-of-Service attack via slow rulesets
findings.description: Evaluation of slow rulesets could be leveraged for a denial-of-service attack.

findings.title: Collision attacks targeting individual nodes
findings.description: The addresses are difficult to compute from the public key, so collision attacks targeting individual nodes are very expensive (but perhaps not insurmountable for a nation-state attacker). Considering the birthday bound for accidental collisions and the potential size of the networks, collisions with addresses of this size may become a concern.

findings.title: Accidental collisions with addresses of this size
findings.description: Collisions with 40-bit ZeroTier addresses may become a concern due to the birthday bound and potential network size, which could lead to duplicate addresses and security issues.

findings.title: Denial-of-Service attacks by adding a host with a duplicate address to the network
findings.description: Preventing denial-of-service attacks by adding a host with a duplicate address to the network or advertising a duplicate address, thereby blackholing traffic to the original node.

findings.title: Identification of a node by the ZeroTier address alone without having a validated public key
findings.description: Preventing identification of a node by the ZeroTier address alone, without having a validated public key to back up its identity.

findings.title: Node ID Collision Vulnerability
findings.description: Permissions, routes, keys, or sensitive data associated with A will be associated with or usable by B if that constitutes a vulnerability

findings.title: AES-CTR misuse
findings.description: Dangerous AES-CTR misuse occurs when the same IV or counter are ever reused for the same key in CTR mode.
